fields.name: Completed activity ratio
fields.formula: if(field('Count activities') = 0,0,round(field('Count completed activities') / field('Count activities') * 100,0))

fields.name: Success ratio
fields.formula: if(field('Count completed campaigns') = 0,0, round(count(filter(field('Campaigns'),lookup('Campaigns','Is success') = 'YES')) / field('Count completed campaigns') * 100,0))

elements.value: 'This text is in the Lato font'

concat('Go to [Google fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) and select the fonts and styles you need. Once you have selected everything, click the **Get embed code** button and choose for the @import statement. Copy / paste this in the custom CSS field.','
','```css','
','@import url(\'https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Lexend+Peta:wght@100..900&display=swap\'); ','
','@import url(\'https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Lato&display=swap\');','
','```')

concat('You can use the browser inspector to check the class names of your elements. For example: the H1 header has the following HTML',' ','>*

10 Custom Code Hacks

*',' ','',' ','Refer to that class name to assign a font in your custom CSS. The example below uses the imported font Lexend Peta for a ```Heading 1``` and ```Heading 2``` element.',' ','A ```Text```, ```Button``` and ```Link``` element will have the font Lato, just like a tag inside a table.',' ','```css',' ','.ab-heading--h1,',' ','.ab-heading--h2 {',' ',' font-family: "Lexend Peta", sans-serif;',' ','}',' ','',' ','.ab-text,',' ','.ab-button,',' ','.ab-link,',' ','.ab-tag {',' ',' font-family: "Lato", sans-serif;',' ','}',' ','```')

concat('This requires some JavaScript to override the ```style``` property of the HTML element with the class name ```.column-element__column```.','
','','
','','
','This property is by default set to 100% divided by the number of columns. The following code allows you to override this. Note that this hack only works with 2 columns because you select each individual column with ```first-child``` or ```last-child```. You need to use ```nth-child()``` when there are more than 2 columns indicating the number of the column between the parentheses.','
','','
','Also note that the querySelector starts with referring to the class ```.column__container``` which is the class name for the ```Column``` element.','
','```js ','
','// select the column','
','const left = document.querySelector(\'.column__container > .column-element__column:first-child\');     ','
','','
','','
','// set the width property to overwrite the CSS variable --column-width ','
','left.setAttribute(\'style\', \'width: 25%\');','
','','
','','
','// do the same for the right column     ','
','const right = document.querySelector(\'.column__container > .column-element__column:last-child\');','
','right.setAttribute(\'style\', \'width: 75%\');','
','```')

concat('A ```Repeat``` element with many items stacked on top of each other can take up a lot of space. This doesn\'t offers the best user experience in a **master-detail view** where you want to show the overview in a ```Repeat ``` element on the left side and the details on the right side because scrolling through the page makes it hard to see the detail information. ','
','','
','','
','','
','','
','This can be solved by adding a class name to the ```Repeat``` element and assign the following css','
','```css','
','.employees__container {','
','    height: 100vh;','
','    overflow: scroll;','
','}','
','```','
','This code sets the height of the ```Repeat``` element to 100 view-height (vh) which is the height of the entire screen. The ```overflow``` property is set to show a scrollbar when the list is higher than the screen ')

concat('Sometimes, you want a bigger area to be clickable than just the ```Link``` element. For example, an entire ```Container``` element.','
','The Repeat element has 2 parts:','
','* A ```Link``` element that contains the actual link','
','* A ```Container``` element that contains everything we want to show in the Repeat element and that must be clickable.','
','','
','The trick here is to move the HTML from the ```Container``` element inside the ```Link``` element. This can be done with the following code. Be sure to check the class names for each element to ensure it references the correct element','
','* **employees__container**: the ```Repeat``` element','
','* **employee__link**: the ```Link``` element that will have it\'s content replaced.','
','* **employee__container**: the ```Container``` element with the ```Text``` and ```Image``` elements.','
','```js','
','','
','// get the repeat element with all employees','
','const employees = document.querySelector(\'.employees__container\')','
','// get the Link and Container elements','
','const links = employees.querySelectorAll(\'.employee__link\')','
','const employee_container = employees.querySelectorAll(\'.employee__container\')','
','// for each link: replace the text with the content from the container','
','links.forEach((link, index) => {','
','    const a = link.querySelector(\'a\')','
','    const employee_content = employee_container[index].parentElement.innerHTML','
','    a.innerHTML = employee_content','
','    // remove the original container','
','    employee_container[index].parentElement.parentElement.removeChild(employee_container[index].parentElement)','
','})','
','``` ','
','The final step is to set the cursor to a pointer to indicate to the user that the entire container is clickable. This is done in CSS.','
','```css','
','.employee__container{ cursor: pointer; }','
','```')

concat('The user needs to have visual feedback that the entire ```Container``` is clickable. This can for example be done by scaling the profile picture of an employee. To do this, simply add the following custom CSS. ','
','```css','
','.employee__container img {','
','    display: block;','
','    transition: all 0.3s ease-in-out;','
','    /* define transition here */','
','}','
','.employee__container:hover img {','
','    transform: scale(1.4);','
','}','
','```','
','Now that there is visual feedback there is no need to underline the text in the ```Link``` element','
','```css','
','.employee__link>a,','
','.employee__link>a:hover {','
','    text-decoration: none;','
','}','
','```')

concat('[ChartJS](https://www.chartjs.org/) is an open source JavaScript library that allows to draw charts on a ``` canvas``` element. There are two requirements for a simple chart:','
','1. An area where it must be drawn. This is done in the ```chart__container``` element ','
','2. One or more datasets. This demo scrapes that data from a ```Table``` element. The table itself can be hidden with CSS is there is no added value in showing it.    ','
','```js','
','// select the Table element','
','const table_data = document.querySelector(\'.objectives__table tbody\');','
','// store the data in arrays','
','const labels = Array.from(table_data.querySelectorAll(\'tr > td:nth-child(1) .ab-text\')).map(i => i.textContent);','
','const budgets = Array.from(table_data.querySelectorAll(\'tr > td:nth-child(4) .ab-text\')).map(i => i.textContent);','
','// create a canvas for the chart','
','const ctx = document.createElement(\'canvas\')','
','document.querySelector(\'.chart__container\').appendChild(ctx)','
','','
','// draw the actual chart','
','new Chart(ctx, {','
','    type: \'polarArea\',','
','    data: {','
','        labels: labels,','
','        datasets: [{','
','            label: \'Budget spend on campaigns\',','
','            data: budgets,','
','            borderWidth: 1','
','        }]','
','    }','
','});','
','','
','// set the width of the chart','
','document.querySelector(\'.chart__container\').style.width = \'960px\';','
','```','
','This is a simple example. Check out the documentation on the [ChartJS](https://www.chartjs.org/) website for variations and further configuration')

concat('This is an extension of6. Draw chart use case. The [MutationObserver](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MutationObserver) is JS can be used to check for changes in the DOM. In this scenario, it checks if the number of records in the ```Table``` element changes because of a filter.','
','The code has been adjusted so that there is a function ```getData()``` that returns an object with the labels and datasets that matches the ```data``` property for the chart.','
','','
','Every time a change is detected in the ```metrics__table```, the chart is updated with the new data.','
','```js','
','const observer = new MutationObserver(() => {','
','    //const data = getData();','
','    chart.data = getData()','
','    chart.update();','
','});','
','observer.observe(table_data, { childList: true });','
','```')
'Metrics for Holiday Bundle Promo - Email Marketing'

concat('The data source contains a field ```Is success```which is a formula field in the database. It contains a status for a campaign. This field will be used to determine the background color of each row in the table.', '
', '', '
', '', '
', 'Most of the work is done with JS. There is a function getColor() that returns a color based on the status. This color is applied to all cells of the row. This is because the row color itself is overwritten during execution.', '
', '```js', '
', '', '
', '', '
', '// select all rows', '
', 'const table_data = document.querySelectorAll(\'.campaigns__table tbody > tr\');', '
', '', '
', '', '
', '// loop over the fows and set the background color based on the value in the 7th column', '
', 'table_data.forEach(row => {', '
', '    const color = getColor(row.querySelector(\'td:nth-child(7) .ab-text\'));', '
', '    row.querySelectorAll(\'td\').forEach(field => field.style.backgroundColor = color);', '
', '});', '
', '```', '
', 'Because the ```Is success``` is only used to determine the background color of a row it can be hidden with CSS.', '
', '```css', '
', '', '
', '.ab-table__cell:nth-child(7),', '
', 'thead .ab-table__header-cell:nth-child(7) {', '
', '    display: none;', '
', '}', '
', '```')

concat('This page contains a long text with a feedback form at the bottom. There is a link - with a button layout - that will scroll to the form. The link will serve as a sticky button at the right bottom of the page. This is done with the following CSS.','
','```css','
','','
','.feedback__add a {','
','    position: fixed;','
','    bottom: 20px;','
','    right: 20px;','
','    width: 60px;','
','    height: 60px;','
','    cursor: pointer;','
','    box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);','
','    display: flex;','
','    justify-content: center;','
','    align-items: center;','
','}','
','```','
','There is also a piece of JS that does the actual scroll to the form when the link is clicked','
','```js','
','document.querySelector(\'.feedback__add a\').addEventListener(\'click\', (e) => {','
','    document.querySelector(\'.form__feedback\').scrollIntoView({ behavior: \'smooth\' });','
','    e.preventDefault();','
','});','
','```')

concat('# Mastering Marketing and Campaign Management in the Digital Age','
','','
','Marketing is no longer about one-way communication or running a few seasonal campaigns. In today’s digital-first world, successful marketing requires **constant engagement, personalized experiences, and agile campaign management**. Businesses that thrive are the ones that can connect with customers at the right time, through the right channels, and with the right message.','
','In this blog post, we’ll explore the fundamentals of marketing and campaign management, the challenges businesses face, and practical strategies you can use to get better results from your efforts.','
','','
','---','
','## Why Campaign Management Matters','
','Campaign management is the process of **planning, executing, tracking, and analyzing marketing initiatives**. It’s the operational backbone that ensures your creative ideas don’t just sound good on paper but actually reach the audience and drive measurable results.','
','A well-executed campaign management process helps you:','
','- Align marketing goals with business objectives.','
','- Target the right audience with relevant messaging.','
','- Track performance in real-time.','
','- Make data-driven adjustments quickly.','
','- Improve ROI across multiple campaigns.','
','Without a structured approach, marketing can easily become **fragmented and inconsistent**, leading to wasted budgets and missed opportunities.','
','---','
','## Key Challenges in Modern Campaign Management','
','Running campaigns today is more complex than ever. Here are a few common challenges:','
','1. **Channel Overload** – With so many platforms (email, social, search, paid ads, influencers), marketers struggle to manage campaigns consistently.','
','2. **Data Fragmentation** – Customer data is often scattered across CRM systems, spreadsheets, analytics platforms, and ad managers.','
','3. **Manual Processes** – Teams still rely on manual reporting and coordination, slowing down execution.','
','4. **Personalization at Scale** – Customers expect tailored experiences, but delivering them across thousands of contacts is challenging.','
','5. **Measuring True Impact** – Attribution remains a headache: how do you know which channel really drove the conversion?','
','Addressing these challenges requires the right mix of **processes, tools, and mindset**.','
','---','
','## Best Practices for Effective Campaign Management','
','Here are some actionable strategies to improve your campaign management process:','
','### 1. Start with Clear Objectives','
','Before launching any campaign, define measurable goals. For example:','
','- Increase email open rates by 20%.','
','- Generate 500 qualified leads from LinkedIn ads.','
','- Drive a 10% increase in e-commerce sales.','
','Specific goals keep your team focused and make it easier to evaluate success later.','
','### 2. Centralize Your Data','
','Create a **single source of truth** for customer and campaign data. This could be a CRM, marketing automation platform, or even a no-code database like Baserow. Centralized data helps avoid confusion and enables consistent messaging across all touchpoints.','
','### 3. Segment and Personalize','
','Instead of blasting the same message to everyone, break your audience into segments (e.g., new leads, active customers, churn risks). Use tailored messaging to increase relevance and engagement.','
','### 4. Use Automation Wisely','
','Automation isn’t just about saving time — it’s about creating **real-time, responsive campaigns**. Examples include:','
','- Triggered emails when a customer abandons their cart.','
','- Dynamic retargeting ads based on browsing behavior.','
','- Scheduling social posts across multiple platforms.','
','### 5. Track the Right Metrics','
','Focus on metrics that align with your business goals:','
','- Engagement (open rates, clicks, shares).','
','- Conversion (leads, sales, sign-ups).','
','- ROI (cost per acquisition, revenue generated).','
','Don’t fall into the trap of vanity metrics that look good but don’t impact your bottom line.','
','### 6. Foster Cross-Team Collaboration','
','Marketing doesn’t exist in a silo. Campaigns often involve sales, product, customer success, and even finance teams. Encourage communication and shared visibility across departments to ensure alignment.','
','','
','---','
','## The Role of Technology in Campaign Management','
','Technology has revolutionized campaign management. Tools now allow even small teams to compete at enterprise levels. Some categories to consider:','
','- **CRM systems** for managing customer data.','
','- **Marketing automation** tools for scheduling, nurturing, and personalization.','
','- **Analytics platforms** for measuring impact across channels.','
','- **Collaboration tools** for planning and execution.','
','For organizations that want more flexibility, no-code platforms like **Baserow** offer customizable campaign management databases that can integrate with automation workflows and APIs.','
','---','
','## Looking Ahead: The Future of Campaign Management','
','As artificial intelligence and machine learning become more accessible, campaign management will shift even further towards **predictive analytics and hyper-personalization**. Marketers will rely less on guesswork and more on systems that can:','
','- Predict customer needs before they arise.','
','- Automatically optimize budgets in real-time.','
','- Generate personalized content variations at scale.','
','The winners will be the businesses that embrace these tools while keeping a **human touch** in their messaging.','
','---','
','## Conclusion','
','Marketing and campaign management are no longer optional — they’re essential to staying competitive in a crowded market. By setting clear goals, centralizing data, personalizing outreach, automating wisely, and measuring the right metrics, you can turn your campaigns into powerful growth drivers.','
','The landscape is constantly evolving, but the principles remain the same: **understand your audience, deliver value, and measure results**. With the right approach, campaign management becomes less of a chore and more of a strategic advantage.')

elements.value:
concat('Pages can be pretty long if they contain a lot of data. Being able to expand and collapse sections is a more user-friendly approach. This page has 3 sections, all with the same structure','
','* A ```Container``` (class name **section**)','
','   * A ```Heading``` (class name **section__header**)','
','   * A ```Containe```r (class name **section__content**)','
','','
','The following CSS adds a small arrow as pseudo element to each ```Heading``` and rotates the arrow each time the ```Heading``` is clicked','
','```css','
','','
','.section__header {','
','    cursor: pointer;','
','    position: relative;','
','    padding-left: 20px;','
','}','
','.section__header::before {','
','    content: "▼";','
','    position: absolute;','
','    left: 0;','
','    top: 50%;','
','    transform: translateY(-50%);','
','    transition: transform 0.3s ease;','
','}','
','.section__header.active::before {','
','    transform: translateY(-50%) rotate(-180deg);','
','}','
','```','
','There is also custom CSS to hide all the content by default by setting the ```max-height``` to 0','
','```css','
','','
','.section__content {','
','    max-height: 0;','
','    overflow: hidden;','
','    transition: max-height 0.3s ease;','
','}','
','```','
','','
','The JavaScript parts listens to a click on each ```Heading``` element, checks if the content of that section is visible or not and reverses the visibility by using the ```maxHeight``` property.','
','```js','
','','
','document.querySelectorAll(\'.section__header\').forEach(header => {','
','    header.addEventListener(\'click\', () => {','
','        const content = header.parentElement.parentElement.nextElementSibling.querySelector(\'.section__content\');','
','        header.classList.toggle(\'active\');','
','        if (content.style.maxHeight) {','
','            content.style.maxHeight = null; // collapse','
','        } else {','
','            content.style.maxHeight = content.scrollHeight + "px"; // expand','
','        }','
','    });','
','});','
','```')
